title: Acadia National Park: People
body: People         David Moses Bridges with a birchbark canoe he built. NPS  The Wabanaki Native American peoples have inhabited the land we now call Maine for 12,000 years. Click here to learn more about the Wabanaki's long history and diverse culture. Ethnography: Asticou's Island Domain: Wabanaki Peoples at Mount Desert Island, Volume 1 and Volume 2.          Important People of Acadia         Sort By: Rating Relevance Recently Updated Title    Show 10 40  per page     Loading results...              Early path committees helped shape Acadia National Park. H.W. Gleason
